page.title: 06BLACKNESS STREET ART,DUNDEE
page.content: The Blackness Environmental Arts Team Project, set up in 1982 with the aim of brightening up the townscape of the industrial area, is the first of its kind in Britain. Backed by MSC, SDA and Dundee District, BEAT have already constructed a{playpark}and{a {specially designed wall}in Union St; a mosaic picture in Tait's Lane was designed by children. There complementary scheme under which artists are commissioned: Peter Flynn's fences in Lochee are {89 six foot squares}which have been stained and dyed to avoid the problems of graffitti.In Belfield St there are {4 decorative tiled panels}on the wall of the coach depot,made by Kenny Munro from pictures of old coaches.Stanley Bonar came up with the bright idea of {decorating the pavements}by adding small white stones to the tarmac.
